name: Garden Plaza Hotel

reviews.text: We booked two rooms as it was Labour Weekend Sunday and we were travelling through NY. The rooms were not cheap. The staff were pleasant but the rooms were dirty and so were the corridors - in fact the whole place needs some redecoration and new carpets. Both oor rooms were dirty - my friend even found a dirty old sock when he dropped somethign behind a dresser and had to look there.
reviews.title: Dirty rooms

reviews.text: Why don't hotels understand that the most basic thing we want is for the rooms to be clean?
reviews.title: Okay, but could use some updating

likes.liked: — Level of overall service, pet friendly, location, room size

reviews.text: I stayed at this property for five nights from July 27-August 1. I was attending a workshop at the Omega Institute with Brian Weiss (Past Life Regression Therapy) and this was the closest hotel (17 miles) I could find that was pet friendly. It was right off Rte. 199 and the Thruway so it was convenient. It is your typical Holiday Inn with the indoor pool and whirlpool (in the Holidome) that was most likely built in the 1980's. Half the rooms are interior and face the Holidome and half face the outside. I was given an inside room because it was conveniently located on the first floor near one of the exits. The carpeting in the hallways was worn and somewhat dirty. The room was big, with a king size bed, dresser, desk, loveseat and coffee table. It was equipped witha hairdryer, iron, ironing board and coffee maker, but no refrigerator. The furniture was clean but worn looking. The bathroom was a typical Holiday Inn bathroom but it did have one of those curved shower curtains that made the shower seem bigger. The shower controls were fine and they provided the amenities of shampoo, body lotion and soap, which were the Body Shop brand, which I thought was relatively upscale for a Holiday Inn. There were plenty of fluffy towels available that I did not need a towel change. However, I did see the maid on the third day and asked for extra shampoo. She happily gave me two bottles. It should be noted that this is a 100% non smoking hotel and it appears that the rule was followed by the other guests given the number of cigarrette butts in the parking lot. (There was a trucker's convention there while I was there but other than the cigarette butts and various trucks in the parking lot one would not have realized they were there) I was hoping that the interior room would not be noisy and it was fine. Actually, I liked the amount of darkness the interior room provided for sleeping. There were several ice and vending machines around the hotel.
reviews.title: Not Bad, No Roaches

likes.liked: — The front desk staff was helpful and kind
likes.disliked: — The interior pool was odd; the restaurant looked pretty bad

reviews.text: The Holidome was fine in terms of the pool, hot tub and sauna (although hot the sauna was showing it's age). They provide pool towels at the pool and one night I accidently brought them back to the room but happily there was no penalty for this (which was nice). The fitness room was clearly an afterthought, with very limited equipment. Room service was excellent, since I took all my meals (except for lunch, which I had at Omega)at the hotel in the room (because of the dog). It should be noted it was always delivered with 8-10 minutes of ordering, rather than the 20-25 minutes they told me when I ordered. The food was always hot and correctly prepared (I usually ask for minor modifications to the meal).They were equally swift in terms of picking up the tray-even though I never called them to pick up the tray it was usually picked up within 5 minutes of me putting it outside the door. This is a nice change from some of the hotels I have stayed in where breakfast trays are still outside the door at dinner time. It appears that any staff member that walks by a tray will pick it up and bring it back, not just the restaurant staff. I cannot comment on the maid service because I kept the Do Not Disturb sign on the door while I was out because of the dog. It should be noted the first day I was at Omega I received a message to call the front desk when I got in. They reported to me that my dog had been crying and barking (she does this when I initially leave her) and she had woken a guest at 5:30AM with her vocalization. I told them that she was sleeping with me at 5:30AM and it certainly was not her because if she vocalized at 5:30AM I definitely would have woken up, and I did not wake up that morning until the wake up call at 7:15AM (wake up calls were always on time at this hotel) and I did not leave the hotel until 8:30AM. They told that this was what was reported to them and they thought I should know. I did ask them it they wanted me to leave and they said no, they just wanted me to know.
reviews.title: Roaches in room!

reviews.text: One nice touch about this hotel was their late check out policy. My workshop at Omega was not ending until 12:00PM and their check time was 11:00AM. However, with prior notice they will allow check out as late as 2:00PM. I notified them about my need for late check out and they said no problem. However, as I was loading up my car at 1:00PM my key stopped working. I went to the front desk and they reprogramed it and I resumed the packing. I left the hotel around 1:30PM.
reviews.title: Best in the area, but not outstanding overall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to Kingston for my husband's 55th high school reunion.The holiday Inn should be closed and renovated. It was dirty, depressing and overpriced. I believe they are opening a Courtyard near Kingston
reviews.title: Do not stay here.

reviews.text: in the future.It was not a $159.00 a nite hotel.
reviews.title: OK for a short stay

reviews.text: Clean and confortable room. Didn't have time to try the pool. Very average breakfast for the price. If we ever need to go back, we wil bring our own breakfast.
reviews.title: It's a Holidome...

reviews.text: The Holiday Inn in Kingston was a good base for our family while attending the HITS Saugerties Horse Show. The facility does show it's age but it is well maintained and clean. For the horse show crowd who travel with their dogs, this hotel accepts pets. The Holiday Inn is close to I-87 making the 15 minute trip to the show grounds easy. We would bypass the hotel for breakfast and head over to Deisings Bakery on Front Street for a great meal. We went back 4 times during our 6 day stay.
reviews.title: Great stay, great price

reviews.text: We stayed here while on a College Tour. The place was comfortable, clean, and went out of their way to accommodate us. We stayed in a non smoking room with two double beds, all furniture and everything appeared to be updated. The pool, hot tub, game area was terrific. Very comfortable, laid back. would not hesitate to return. We loved it.
reviews.title: better then I expected

reviews.text: I ended up paying about $140/night, and it felt like I am staying in something above a motel and below a hotel. Hotel seemed a bit pricey for an off the highway place, but the king room was luxurious.
reviews.title: Midway between an Motel and a Hotel

reviews.text: They have buffet breakfast on weekends. It was about $10, but felt selection was particularly poor. Though they may have had some tomatoes and sausages, I do not recall any Swiss cheese or salamis. I do not recommend the buffet. Probably can drive across the street and pick a doughnut and coffee for $2.50.
reviews.title: nothing too great, nothing too terrible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised with the dinner menu. Had dinner there on 2 subsequent nights, and both dinners came around $60/each total (food, tax, and tip). You get a salad bar, appetizer, main course, desserts. The Beaujolais was properly priced around $23/bottle. Escargot appetizer was very nice too. Restaurant is understaffed, so service is memorably slow.
reviews.title: Not Holiday Inn quality

reviews.text: I pay $75/bottle for the wine in NYC, so being able to buy a 3 course dinner with salad bar, 1 bottle of Beaujolais, tax and tip for $60, and be pleasantly surprised by this off the thoroughfare joint was a pleasant experience.
reviews.title: Ok stay

reviews.text: I stayed here with friends for a weekend getaway. They had a discounted rate so it was well worth the $100 or so that the room cost us but it is probably overpriced if you are paying full price. The best thing about it was the comfortable bed. It was clean, the room and bathroom were clean, and we got a first floor room so the no elevator thing was not an issue. I thought the place would be a little kids' dream with the pool and huge arcade but my kids were not with me so no one engaged in those activities. Yes, there is a lot of disrepair in the place like the hallway carpets are coming up, and some of the wings (near the back parking lot) smell kind of funky. My non smoking room was fine, though and looked newer than a lot of the rest of the hotel (maybe it was?). Overall, though, I'd say everything was pretty much on par with other average Holiday Inns - we all thought that HI Express would've been better, to get a free breakfast out of the deal at least. I would stay here again for the discounted rate.
reviews.title: ANTS!!!!

reviews.text: We are staying at this hotel for the weekend. Historically, over the past 12 years, we have stayed at this property every time we visit Kingston, NY. In the past 12 years we have seen a steady decline in the quality of the rooms. By contrast we have always found the staff to be friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Not a Good Value for the Money

reviews.text: A key concern of this property is that the rooms are sorely lacking in basic upgrades and has no elevator although it has a 2nd floor. Our room was more or less clean; however, the carpet, drapes and furniture had a moldy/dusty smell.
reviews.title: Clean, and the pool was great.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What was outdated? Bathroom, Mattress (too soft), dusty drapes, Old-style TV (CRT), HUGE water stain in the ceiling (see pictures) and a mildew-lined bath tub (see pictures). What I just described would be more in-line with $75/night hotel not a $150/night hotel.
reviews.title: Basic Good Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon check-in we could hear noises from the hallway as well as adjacent rooms – people were partying in the rooms. We had to call the front desk twice to get this rectified.
reviews.title: Beware! Housekeepers are rude and room was not clean

reviews.text: Amenities in the room included: coffee maker, hair dryer, iron, ironing board (Broken). The room also had a night light in the bathroom, refrigerator & microwave.
reviews.title: We had a great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went online and booked the Winter special for this hotel ($189 for two nights) for a ski vacation.
reviews.title: Good location for Catskills skiing/exploring

reviews.text: The location was ideal, just off of I-87, making it easy to get to Kingston, nearby Woodstock, as well as the ski resorts of Belleayre and Hunter. There's also lots of shopping nearby to stock up on amenities.
reviews.title: Ok for a night

reviews.text: The room itself was nice--clean and roomy. The room did feel dated. The bathroom showed the most wear (yellowish popcorn ceilings), but the showerhead and shower were good.
reviews.title: Great place to stay !

likes.disliked: — Inside room facing the pool and activities center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel keeps the halls roasting hot during this cold snap, so it felt a little like a sauna walking in (which we liked).
reviews.title: Ok to stop over if you're in transit somewhere

reviews.text: Staff was very friendly, both during checkin and helping us find local things to do.
reviews.title: Overpriced, but options are limited

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an update of a recent review of this property in which I'd incorrectly referred to this hotel having wired and wireless broadband connections in-room; in fact it has wireless only in rooms. The rest of the review remains the same with only the most minor changes.
reviews.title: Decent if over-priced

reviews.text: Some previous reviewers here seemed to have made a wrong turn and stayed at the Bates Motel rather than the Holiday Inn Kingston NY. We needed a room in Kingston on a busy college graduation weekend, better-reviewed properties were full, and I was a bit concerned about this reservation; I needn't have worried. We enjoyed a good night's sleep in a clean and comfortable hotel. The value, though, left something to be desired.
reviews.title: It's actually fine, as long as you don't depend on their wireless

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nowadays, travelers' standards and expectations have changed, and we expect more in the way of amenities. When virtually every place in its class, every Hampton Inn, Fairfield Inn, Comfort Inn AND HOLIDAY INN EXPRESS, to mention a few, offers a fridge, microwave, in-room coffee-maker AND 24 hour coffee in the lobby, (and often an evening snack of cookies or fruit) and some form of complimentary breakfast (often including a wide variety and at least some hot dishes,) this property offers only the in-room coffee-maker, with breakfast available for purchase in their coffee shop.
reviews.title: average room
Just Fine
reviews.text: So, here are some good and bad points about the Holiday Inn Kingston, NY:

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Good:
reviews.title: Excellent Suprise

reviews.text: After reading the previous reviews I wasn't sure what to expect at this hotel. I have to say that while the hotel is not super modern, it is nicely decorated and clean. Check-in was fast and there was an employee to help me with my bag, since there is no elevator. I stayed in the "Executive Wing" in an outside room. The room was clean, quiet, and well-appointed with a very comfortable king-size bed,sofa, fridge, and microwave. The bathroom was not new, but was very clean, and everything worked well. The sheets and towels were very clean-smelling, which is important to me. The hotel offers a buffet breakfast for $10.95, and the food was plentiful and the service excellent. All-in-all, my stay at this Holiday Inn exceeded my expectations.
reviews.title: Better than I expected
Nice staff, 1st time in a "Holidome", run down
reviews.text: Very nice and accommodating staff. The hotel could use a major renovation. Because the pool is indoors most of the hotel smells strongly of chlorine. No elevator so we had to bring our luggage up a flight of stairs, not the end of the world since we were only there for 2 nights. Make sure you take time to visit nearby mansions (Vanderbilts of Hyde Park, FDR Library, etc...)

reviews.title: Nice people, tired hotel
reviews.text: Stayed here recently for 2 nights. The rooms were dated and tired looking, this is an old holidome style holiday inn. Upon check in paid 102.00 per night as the best rate, later to hear someone check in with an 85.00 rate from the newspaper. Late at night I realized that there was NO POWER on one entire wall, the manager asked to come in my room and "fix" it. A bit uncomfortable having a strange man in my room. He gave up (he was very professional). I suggested that he move me, and he tried the connecting room, that had NO POWER on the same wall. Finally I was moved across the hall.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This property needs come attention and some money put back into it... Lately Holiday Inn is hit or miss for me!
reviews.title: Look elsewhere!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel for its convenient location to several events we were attending. Unfortunately, location is about all it has to offer. As previous reviewers have noted, this place is very old and badly in need of a facelift or, better yet, a date with the wrecking ball. First--there's no elevator--so if you're travelling with a lot of bags, as we were, it's a major pain to navigate the scruffy and poorly lit stairwells. The room hadn't had a good cleaning in some time and the bathroom was tiny with mold, mildew and grunge everywhere. The "restaurant" was no prize either, offering poorly cooked food delivered by servers who were more interested in getting back to their conversations. And the grounds were as poorly maintained as the rest of the place. We couldn't wait to leave.
reviews.title: Convenient hotel
Dirty and unpleasant
reviews.text: The website photos are extremely misleading, and as a result, I was unpleasantly surprised when I walked into my guest room. As I opened the door I was greeted with a muggy wave of what smelled like sweaty soccer cleats, along with a carpet that was so dirty and stained that I was not comfortable walking on it bare foot. I also found bugs in my bathroom on three separate occasions during my stay and had an ill-functioning shower. In short, nowhere near worth the $190 rate I was paying on some nights.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Holiday Inn in Kingston is easy to find as it is close to the New York State Thruway. It is in a quiet area, making for good sound sleep in its comfortable beds. The staff was gracious and welcoming and our room was comfortable, especially since it had a fridge and a microwave.
reviews.title: Good stay in an interesting part of the country

reviews.text: We learned quite a bit of New York history on this trip after visiting the Senate House in Kingston, and two properties in Dutchess County across the Hudson - Clermont (family seat of the Livingstons and name-sake for Robert Fulton's steam boat financed by one of the clan) and Montgomery Place (founded by the widow of the famous General Montgomery who lost his life fighting against the British in Quebec early in the Revolutionary War). We also enjoyed a visit to Olana, the Persian-inspired home of Hudson River School painter Frederick Church which is just south of the town of Hudson. Olana should not be missed if you are in the neighborhood.
reviews.title: Needs updating and some ambience

reviews.text: OK, I recently saw the movie Cedar Rapids, Iowa and couldn't help comparing the hotel depicted in that movie to the Holiday Inn in Kingston. The holidome may have been cool in the past (maybe it still is and I am just too old to appreciate this), but this place has a somber, depressing mood hanging over it. There is a weird smell in the hallways (even though it is a non-smoking facility), and the place just looks and feels "tired". The carpeting in the hallways is buckled and coming up in several places which actually makes walking on it quite treacherous if you're not paying attention. The hallway carpeting was also very filthy. I stayed in the executive wing and it was no better than anywhere else. The tub and bath fixtures have seen better days and there are obvious areas where there has been water damage on the ceiling and shabby repairs made to cover it up. The room itself was clean and the bed had updated bedding & nice pillows. The decor wasn't too bad as it looked like they had made an effort to modernize the pictures, walls and fixtures. The TV was still an old CRT, no flat screens here. For the price I paid (approx. $140 during a week night), I expected more. The internet did come with the room at that price, but no breakfast. I did not eat on the property and their were very few guests dining or in the bar although the hotel was moderately full. Perhaps this would be an OK place to stay if you had young children and it was conveniently located to the attractions. The pool & game area looked dark, dingy and had no music or lively atmosphere but hey! who cares if your a kid and you have a handful of tokens to enjoy?? All in all I would not stay here again as I think I could get more for my money elsewhere. Oh, the front desk staff did not seem professional at all, although pleasant for the most part. You also have to drag your luggage quite a ways and carry it up stairs by hand as there is no elevator. Be prepared if you have kids or a lot of stuff to carry that you will be making several trips up and down stairs unless you get the first floor.
reviews.title: The worst

reviews.text: Hotel staff (esp front desk) very unpleasant. Told me my reservation @ $110 was wrong and should have been $184. After much discussion they finally honored my quoted rate, but said I was "getting a good deal". Not for this place - old, dirty & stinky.
reviews.title: Overdue for a renovation

description: Welcome to the Garden Plaza Hotel, Kingston, NY – formerly the Holiday Inn. Located in the Hudson River Valley region of New York State, the picturesque beauty of the Catskill Mountains surrounds our hotel. Centered between Albany and New York City, this Kingston hotel is easily accessible from the NYS Thruway (I-87) at exit 19. Leisure guests should know that activities change with the season, ensuring there is always something new to do near our lodging. The Catskills offer hiking and tubing in the summer and spring, county fairs and apple picking in the fall and skiing during the winter. We're the perfect pet-friendly hotel for guests participating in the Horse Shows in the Sun in Saugerties. Business travelers trekking between New York and Albany often seek lodging at our Catskills hotel and enjoy the calm, scenic atmosphere. The 24-hour Business Center and free Wi-Fi access are at your disposal as you work. We have a ballroom and a boardroom for your next corporate event, and an indoor courtyard for more casual social gatherings. At the Garden Plaza Hotel, Kingston, NY, we feature packages throughout the year to bundle your stay with activities like snow skiing at Belleayre, Hunter or Windham Mountain or golfing in the scenic Hudson Valley or Catskills . Enjoy hiking, biking and sightseeing in this historic Hudson River Valley region. Plenty of fun can be found at the hotel, too, in the Garden Courtyard, with an indoor pool, sauna whirlpool and game room. Call today to book your next stay!Complimentary Breakfast from 7am to 10am daily. Louie's restaurant on premises serving dinner and providing room service from 5pm to 10pm daily. On site bar Gather's open from 5pm to closing daily. Businesses near the hotel:United Health Care, Huck/Alcoa, Ametek Rotron, Kingston Hospital, Benedictine Hospital, Adirondack Trailways, Bank of America, Ulster Savings Bank, Smith Barney, Ulster County Community College, Bard College, Northeast Center for Special Care and Iron Mountain.
